thread.title: Katie Price names and shames 'bully' for online abuse at son Harvey
thread.title_full: Katie Price names and shames 'bully' for online abuse at son Harvey

author: Emma Powell
title: Katie Price names and shames 'bully' for online abuse at son Harvey
text:
Katie Price names and shames ‚Äòbully‚Äô for online abuse at son Harvey 
Price called on her followers to help her identify the ‚Äúbully‚Äù Tuesday 24 January 2017 16:13 BST Click to followES Entertainment Speaking out: Katie Price with her son Harvey Ken McKay/ITV/Rex 
Katie Price has publicly called out an online troll for posting a nasty comment about her disabled son. 
Price, 37, called on her followers to help her identify a ‚Äòbully‚Äô who made inappropriate comments about Harvey. 
The former glamour model posted the name and Twitter profile of a user who had Photoshopped a picture of her son on a packet of Haribo and another on a King Kong DVD which had been changed to ‚ÄòKing M**g‚Äô. 
Sharing a screenshot of the imaged on Twitter, Price tweeted: ‚ÄúCaught out!! Another bully on our hands. Anyone know this guy??‚Äù Caught out!! Another bully on our hands. Anyone know this guy?? üò° pic.twitter.com/xQIXn8C1IN ‚Äî Katie Price (@MissKatiePrice) January 24, 2017 
Fans praised the Loose Women panellist for calling the user out on social media with some deeming the troll ‚Äúdisgusting‚Äù while others said they had been left ‚Äúhorrified‚Äù. 
On fan tweeted: ‚ÄúBeyond belief and just vile!!! Name and shame! X.‚Äù 
Another begged for Price to get in touch to offer advice, writing: ‚ÄúPlease DM me ‚Äì I had hate email about my son, went to police and the sender was traced and dealt with ‚Äì this is NOT OK.‚Äù Katie Price to campaign against social media trolls 
Price had Harvey with Dwight Yorke. He was born blind and suffers from autism, ADHD and Prader-Willi syndrome. Katie Price claims hospital admitted they caused son's brain damage 
After hours of naming and shaming Price called for better policing of sites such as Twitter and Instagram. 
She tweeted: ‚ÄúThere should be more done to stop this happening to people like me and others so angry and upset.‚Äù 
She also challenged trolls to join her on Loose Women to explain the abuse.
